title: Poison cloud
data:
**Poison clouds**, sometimes known as **stinking clouds**, are a [dungeon feature](/wiki/Dungeon_feature "Dungeon feature") that appear in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. Like normal [clouds](/wiki/Cloud "Cloud"), they block line of sight while allowing [you](/wiki/You "You"), other monsters, projectiles and spells to pass through them unobstructed. However, poison clouds are much more dangerous to walk through.

The area covered by a poison cloud is represented by #[![Cloud.png](/images/d/d2/Cloud.png)](/wiki/File:Cloud.png) - poison clouds are only displayed when actually in your line of sight, whereas regular clouds remain mapped even while [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Description](#Description)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Messages](#Messages)

- [6 Variants](#Variants)

  - [6.1 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [6.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [6.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [6.4 DynaHack](#DynaHack)
  - [6.5 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [6.6 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [7 References](#References)

## Generation

Poison clouds occur naturally in the [Plane of Fire](/wiki/Plane_of_Fire "Plane of Fire"), where the lava produces plumes of poison gas intermittently.

Poison clouds can also be created through the following methods:

- The poison [breath](/wiki/Breath "Breath") weapon of a [green dragon](/wiki/Green_dragon "Green dragon"), an [iron golem](/wiki/Iron_golem "Iron golem"), or a randomly selected breath attack from the [Chromatic Dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon "Chromatic Dragon")
- A read [scroll of stinking cloud](/wiki/Scroll_of_stinking_cloud "Scroll of stinking cloud")

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

[Hezrou](/wiki/Hezrou "Hezrou") leave poisonous clouds behind as they move.

Per [commit 4b52537](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/4b525374d039420916be2f002f5d32a98c046996), [vrocks](/wiki/Vrock "Vrock") can now emit a plume of poison clouds when fleeing, similar to the scroll of stinking cloud.

Per [commit fe34d4e3](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/fe34d4e3e37cc2002e1473e10a96cade16150366), [the Minion of Huhetotl](/wiki/The_Minion_of_Huhetotl "The Minion of Huhetotl"), the [Chromatic Dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon "Chromatic Dragon") and [Nalzok](/wiki/Nalzok "Nalzok") create plumes of poison clouds upon death. Per [commit 8b9a93f7](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/8b9a93f797eb52f611f9cb682b9d68311c8dbbdc), the hero will not be blamed for damage done by poison clouds from killing a quest nemesis.

## Description

Poison clouds obstruct vision from the outside, and being caught within one can be deadly - walking through them renders you blind and inflicts steady damage each turn you remain inside, eventually killing you unless you can make you way out. Monsters are subjected to those same effects, taking damage unless they are [nonliving](/wiki/Nonliving "Nonliving") or [unbreathing](/wiki/Unbreathing "Unbreathing"), and monsters with eyes are [blinded](/wiki/Blind "Blind") - possessing [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance") will prevent you or a monster from taking any damage, but the gas will still blind and induce coughing regardless.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Wearing a [wet](/wiki/Wet "Wet") [towel](/wiki/Towel "Towel") halves damage from poison clouds.

Per [commit 0eb88963](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/0eb8896301f20435205b57077159b523faaf3a43), paranoid confirmations cover walking into known poison clouds.

## Strategy

While you will generally encounter a source of poison resistance far before you have to deal with poison clouds, they can still leave you blinded, which can be a hassle unless you have a means to cure it and/or a way to maintain sight of hostile monsters, such as [telepathy](/wiki/Telepathy "Telepathy") or [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning").

## History

Poison clouds are introduced with the scroll of stinking cloud in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

In [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3") and previous versions, including some variants based on those versions, poison clouds are subject to some [now-fixed bugs](/wiki/Bugs_in_NetHack_3.4.3 "Bugs in NetHack 3.4.3"):

- Monsters affected by stinking clouds always get angry at you, even if you did not create the cloud. This is bug C341-1 and was declared fixed in January 2004; while 3.4.3 mostly fixes the bug, it can still occur if loading a bones file from an older game in the 3.4 series.
- The display of stinking clouds on the map may be incorrect when wearing the [Eyes of the Overworld](/wiki/Eyes_of_the_Overworld "Eyes of the Overworld"). This is bug C343-213 and was fixed on September 21, 2006.
- The [invulnerability](/wiki/Invulnerability "Invulnerability") granted from a successful [prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer") does not prevent damage from poison clouds. This is bug #H2645 according to the commit that fixed it ([commit 0add5217](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/0add5217)), and the fix was made in 2012.

## Messages

- Something is burning your \<lungs>! You cough and spit blood!

  You are affected by a poison cloud and do not have poison resistance.

- You cough.

  As above, but you are poison resistant and take no damage from the poison cloud.

- Your eyes sting!

  You were blinded by the poison cloud.

- \<monster> coughs!

  A breathing, living monster is affected by the stinking cloud. This message is printed regardless of whether or not they possess poison resistance.

## Variants

The [Itlachiayaque](/wiki/Itlachiayaque "Itlachiayaque") patch, which replaces the [Archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact") with Itlachiayaque and is implemented in some form in many variants, can be #[invoked](/wiki/Invoked "Invoked") to create a targeted, seven-tile diameter poison cloud, similar to a blessed scroll of stinking cloud.

### GruntHack

[GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack") fixes the 3.4.3 prayer-related bug that does not prevent damage from poison clouds.

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), [dungeon fern](/wiki/Dungeon_fern "Dungeon fern") spores primarily attack by exploding into small poison clouds, which can sometimes be avoided by standing diagonally to them. Dungeon ferns and their sprouts can create these spores, as does reading a blessed scroll of stinking cloud while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused"). A [bag of tricks](/wiki/Bag_of_tricks "Bag of tricks") also has a 1⁄40 chance of producing a posion cloud when [applied](/wiki/Applied "Applied").

[Cthulhu](/wiki/Cthulhu "Cthulhu") will disintegrate into a mass of poison clouds when defeated, but will reform again after a short amount of turns.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), the lair of the [Avatar of Lolth](/wiki/Avatar_of_Lolth "Avatar of Lolth") has permanent poison clouds that lack gravity or a floor; a character that enters them will be subject to the same movement rules as on the [Plane of Air](/wiki/Plane_of_Air "Plane of Air").

More monsters utilize poison clouds as well:

- The [poison gas](/index.php?title=Poison_gas\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Poison gas (page does not exist)") mage spell used by Cuprilach [Rilmani](/wiki/Rilmani "Rilmani") creates clouds of poison gas.
- [Yochlols](/wiki/Yochlol "Yochlol") can transform into a [vortex](/wiki/Vortex "Vortex") form called a "stinking cloud", which has an [engulfing](/wiki/Engulf "Engulf") attack with the same effects as regular poison clouds.
- [Changed](/wiki/Changed "Changed") that fall below 1⁄2 HP will stop restoring health naturally and begin releasing small poison clouds, losing 1 HP per turn - this ensures the changed will eventually die, which produces a large cloud of poison.
- As in UnNetHack, Cthulhu will disintegrate into a mass of poison clouds if defeated, but reforms after a short amount of turns.

### DynaHack

In [DynaHack](/wiki/DynaHack "DynaHack"), the bag of tricks works as it does in UnNetHack, including the chance of producing poison clouds on application.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), hezrou leave poisonous clouds as they move, reflecting their encyclopedia entry. The [Archeologist](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis") will use Itlachiayaque to summon poison clouds around you.

Stinking clouds created by reading a scroll no longer use a predefined rhombus shape, and instead expand from their origin point to fit the terrain. This makes them even more dangerous in closed spaces.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), hezrou also leave poisonous clouds as they move. Monsters will also read the scroll of stinking cloud.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/region.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 971](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/region.c#L971)

Poison cloud

From NetHackWiki

Poison clouds, sometimes known as stinking clouds, are a dungeon feature that appear in NetHack. Like normal clouds, they block line of sight while allowing you, other monsters, projectiles and spells to pass through them unobstructed. However, poison clouds are much more dangerous to walk through.

The area covered by a poison cloud is represented by # - poison clouds are only displayed when actually in your line of sight, whereas regular clouds remain mapped even while blind.

Poison clouds can also be created through the following methods:

  • The poison breath weapon of a green dragon, an iron golem, or a randomly selected breath attack from the Chromatic Dragon

Poison clouds obstruct vision from the outside, and being caught within one can be deadly - walking through them renders you blind and inflicts steady damage each turn you remain inside, eventually killing you unless you can make you way out. Monsters are subjected to those same effects, taking damage unless they are nonliving or unbreathing, and monsters with eyes are blinded - possessing poison resistance will prevent you or a monster from taking any damage, but the gas will still blind and induce coughing regardless.[1]

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (NetHack 3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

While you will generally encounter a source of poison resistance far before you have to deal with poison clouds, they can still leave you blinded, which can be a hassle unless you have a means to cure it and/or a way to maintain sight of hostile monsters, such as telepathy or warning.

Poison clouds are introduced with the scroll of stinking cloud in NetHack 3.3.0.

In NetHack 3.4.3 and previous versions, including some variants based on those versions, poison clouds are subject to some now-fixed bugs:

UnNetHack

In dNetHack, the lair of the Avatar of Lolth has permanent poison clouds that lack gravity or a floor; a character that enters them will be subject to the same movement rules as on the Plane of Air.

  • The poison gas mage spell used by Cuprilach Rilmani creates clouds of poison gas.
